column2: Activate §Y[Root.GetID]§!. This will not automatically give the title a holder.
Add one of the 4 types of claims upon §Y[Root.GetID]§! ([Root.GetBaseName]).
Spawn a new character with a claim on §Y[Root.GetID]§! and start them upon a claimant adventure for it.
Deactivate §Y[Root.GetID]§!.\n\n§MNOTE:§! It will no longer be possible to locate via Find Title.

Destroy §Y[Root.GetID]§! outright.\n\n§MNOTE:§! If this is the holder's primary title and another same-tier title is held, the other title will first be made primary to avoid a mess. This is definitely "unsafe."
DEV: Target as De Jure Liege

Target §Y[Root.GetID]§! ([Root.GetBaseName]) as a de jure liege title to which de jure vassal titles may be assigned. A 'De Jure Vassalize' title decision will become available on all next-lowest-tier titles to set §Y[Root.GetID]§! as their de jure liege title. This may be done repeatedly.

An alert will be present while this title is selected for de jure vassal reassignment so that you may quickly return here to finish (i.e., deselect this title).

If working with multiple liege titles, you need not explicitly "finish" each one: simply re-target.
DEV: Untarget as De Jure Liege
Stop targeting §Y[Root.GetID]§! ([Root.GetBaseName]) as a de jure liege title to which de jure vassals may be assigned. Note that this is purely a UI function, as de jure reassignment is immediate.
DEV: Finish De Jure Reassignment for [Root.GetID]
Set the de jure liege title of §Y[Root.GetID]§! ([Root.GetBaseName]) to §Y[emf_debug_dj_liege.GetID]§! ([emf_debug_dj_liege.GetBaseName]).
Force §Y[Root.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! to grant the §Y[Root.GetFullBaseName]§! to me.

Reduce all of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s playable vassals' opinion of [Root.GetHerHim] by §R-25§! for §Y3§! years. This only affects patricians or count- or higher-tier vassals-- not vassal barons from [Root.GetHerHis] demesne.

Increase all of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s playable vassals' opinion of [Root.GetHerHim] by §G25§! for §Y3§! years. This only affects patricians or count- or higher-tier vassals-- not vassal barons from [Root.GetHerHis] demesne.
Spawn a new debugging army & fleet for §Y[Root.GetBestName]§!. You'll be prompted with options regarding army size.
Usurp all held titles of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. However, landless titles will NOT be usurped, so characters with landless titles will still be rulers afterward.
Usurp or, if necessary, create the §Y[Root.GetFullBaseName]§!.

Spawn an army that can be inherited, won't automatically disband on peace, automatically reinforces, and doesn't suffer from attrition. An ample yet appropriately sized fleet will also be spawned to transport them. You may later disband all armies and fleets of this type at once with the corresponding 'Disband Debug Armies' targeted decision. How large should this army be?
What type of claim should be made upon the [From.GetFullName]?
Has at least one playable vassal\n
